get hemisphere from lat/long coordinates

Source: R/parse_hemisphere.R
parse_hemisphere.Rd

BEWARE: EXPERIMENTAL

parse_hemisphere(lat, lon)

Arguments

lat

(character/numeric/integer) one or more latitude values
lon

(character/numeric/integer) one or more longitude values

Value

character vector of quadrants, one of: NE, NW, SE, SW. if one of the coordinate values is invalid, and one is valid, you get the a length 1 string. if both coordinate values are bad, you get zero length string.

Details

length(lat) == length(lon)

Examples

# NE
parse_hemisphere("45N54.2356", "74.123E")
#> [1] "NE"
# NW
parse_hemisphere("40.4183318", "-120")
#> [1] "NW"
# SW
parse_hemisphere("-40.4183318", "-120")
#> [1] "SW"
# SE
parse_hemisphere("-40.4183318", "120")
#> [1] "SE"

# bad inputs, get one of the two strings
parse_hemisphere("-40.4183318", "-181")
#> Warning: not within -90/90 range, got: -181
#> [1] "S"
parse_hemisphere("-192.4183318", "-120")
#> Warning: not within -90/90 range, got: -192.4183318
#> [1] "W"

# many inputs
library(randgeo)
pts <- rg_position(count = 1000)
lats <- as.character(vapply(pts, "[[", 1, 2))
lons <- as.character(vapply(pts, "[[", 1, 1))
parse_hemisphere(lats, lons)
#>    [1] "SW" "NE" "NW" "NW" "SE" "NE" "NW" "NW" "NW" "SW" "SW" "NE" "SE" "SW"
